metadata.title: CVE-2022-3544 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability, which was classified as problematic, was found in LinuxKernel. Affected is the function damon_sysfs_add_target of the filemm/damon/sysfs.c of the component Netfilter. The manipulation leads tomemory leak. It is recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue. Theidentifier of this vulnerability is VDB-211044.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3544` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
